xxl.core.spatial.cursors
Class GESS

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.joins.SortMergeJoin
          xxl.core.spatial.cursors.Orenstein
              xxl.core.spatial.cursors.GESS
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator, Cursor
public class GESS
extends Orenstein

This class provides the similarity-join algorithm "GESS: Generic External Space Sweep" (see "[DS 01] GESS: a Scalable Algorithm for Mining Large Datasets in High Dimensional Spaces by Jens-Peter Dittrich and Bernhard Seeger, ACM SIGKDD 2001." for a detailed description of this method).

The most important component of this algorithm is the Replicator-Engine (Replicator) which determines the partition(s) for incoming points and maps Points to KPEzCodes.

The use-case implemented in the main-method of this class reads 1 or 2 inputs and computes the similarity-join using GESS. The use-case provided with this class reads files containing FloatPoints.

Note that GESS works on arbitrary data as long as the user provides a mapping to the internally used FixedPointRectangle-type (see parameter "inputMapping").

See Also:
Replicator, Orenstein, MSJ, FixedPoint, FixedPointRectangle, KPEzCode, SortMergeJoin

Constructor Detail

GESS

public GESS(java.util.Iterator input0,
            java.util.Iterator input1,
            Function inputMapping,
            Predicate joinPredicate,
            Predicate splitAllowed,
            int minBitIndex,
            Function newSorter,
            Function newResult,
            int dimensions,
            int initialCapacity)
Creates a new GESS-operator (Constructor for two inputs).

Parameters:
input0 - first (unsorted) input
input1 - second (unsorted) input
inputMapping - a Function used to map incoming objects of arbitrary type to a FixedPointRectangle (internally used by the replication engine)
joinPredicate - the join predicate to be used by this join (e.g. DistanceWithin-predicate)
splitAllowed - the replication strategy to be applied by GESS (see inner class Replicator.Split)
minBitIndex - the minimal bit-index to be considered for the replication-process ( 0 <= bitIndex <= 62 )
newSorter - a factory-Function that returns a sorting-operator (e.g. MergeSorter)
newResult - a factory-Function that is used to create the result-tuples that are returned by this operator (e.g. Tuplify)
dimensions - the dimensionality of the data
initialCapacity - the maximum number of elements that can be stored inside main-memory (i.e. by the SweepArea)
